title: URIs
summary: Uniform Resource Identifiers (URI) are used to identify "resources" on the web. They are commonly used as targets of HTTP requests, in which case the URI represents a location for a physical resource, such as a document, a photo, binary data, etc. URIs can also be used to trigger behaviors other than fetching a resource, including opening the email client, sending text messages, or executing JavaScript, when used in other places such as the href of an HTML <a> link.
